title: Authors and Citation
text: Tina Fu. Author, maintainer. Bob Taylor. Author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Fu T, Taylor B (2024). phsstyles: Standard Graphic Styles use Public Health Scotland. R package version 0.1.2, https://public-health-scotland.github.io/phsstyles/, https://github.com/Public-Health-Scotland/phsstyles.
code: @Manual{,   title = {phsstyles: Standard Graphic Styles for use in Public Health Scotland},   author = {Tina Fu and Bob Taylor},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.1.2, https://public-health-scotland.github.io/phsstyles/},   url = {https://github.com/Public-Health-Scotland/phsstyles}, }

what: Standard Graphic Styles for use in Public Health Scotland
title: Standard Graphic Styles for use in Public Health Scotland
text: 8 colours use Public Health Scotland (PHS): 4 main colours (PHS purple, PHS magenta, PHS blue PHS green) 4 supporting colours (PHS graphite, PHS teal, PHS liberty PHS rust) Within colour 5 gradients (e.g. PHS purple, contains 100%, 80%, 50%, 30% 10%) 8 colours shown : colour gradients shown :  Please see Chart Dashboard Accessibility Guidance information. phsstyles contains functions creating graphics standard styles PHS: phs_colours() returns hex value specific named colours theme_phs() apply pre-defined PHS theme charts scale_colour_discrete_phs() apply discrete PHS colour scales charts scale_colour_continuous_phs() apply continuous PHS colour scales charts scale_fill_discrete_phs() apply discrete PHS colour filling scales charts scale_fill_continuous_phs() apply continuous PHS colour filling scales charts phsstyles can used server desktop versions RStudio.

title: Standard Graphic Styles for use in Public Health Scotland
text: install phsstyles, package remotes required, can installed install.packages("remotes"). can install phsstyles RStudio server GitHub : Network security settings may prevent remotes::install_github() working RStudio desktop. case, phsstyles can installed downloading zip repository running following code (replacing section marked <>, including arrows ):
code: remotes::install_github("Public-Health-Scotland/phsstyles",   upgrade = "never" ) remotes::install_local("<FILEPATH OF ZIPPED FILE>/phsstyles-master.zip",   upgrade = "never" )

title: Standard Graphic Styles for use in Public Health Scotland
text: Load phsstyles using library(): access help file phsstyles’ functions, type ?function_name RStudio console loading package:
code: library(phsstyles) ?phs_colours

title: Standard Graphic Styles for use in Public Health Scotland
code: # Generate hex code for those colours phs_colours(c("phs-blue", "phs-purple")) #> [1] "#0078D4" "#3F3685"  # List hex code for all the available colours phs_colours() #>      phs-purple     phs-magenta        phs-blue       phs-green    phs-graphite  #>       "#3F3685"       "#9B4393"       "#0078D4"       "#83BB26"       "#948DA3"  #>        phs-teal     phs-liberty        phs-rust   phs-purple-80   phs-purple-50  #>       "#1E7F84"       "#6B5C85"       "#C73918"       "#655E9D"       "#9F9BC2"  #>   phs-purple-30   phs-purple-10  phs-magenta-80  phs-magenta-50  phs-magenta-30  #>       "#C5C3DA"       "#ECEBF3"       "#AF69A9"       "#CDA1C9"       "#E1C7DF"  #>  phs-magenta-10     phs-blue-80     phs-blue-50     phs-blue-30     phs-blue-10  #>       "#F5ECF4"       "#3393DD"       "#80BCEA"       "#B3D7F2"       "#E6F2FB"  #>    phs-green-80    phs-green-50    phs-green-30    phs-green-10 phs-graphite-80  #>       "#9CC951"       "#C1DD93"       "#DAEBBE"       "#F3F8E9"       "#A9A4B5"  #> phs-graphite-50 phs-graphite-30 phs-graphite-10     phs-teal-80     phs-teal-50  #>       "#CAC6D1"       "#DFDDE3"       "#F4F4F6"       "#4B999D"       "#8FBFC2"  #>     phs-teal-30     phs-teal-10  phs-liberty-80  phs-liberty-50  phs-liberty-30  #>       "#BCD9DA"       "#E9F2F3"       "#897D9D"       "#B5AEC2"       "#D3CEDA"  #>  phs-liberty-10     phs-rust-80     phs-rust-50     phs-rust-30     phs-rust-10  #>       "#F0EFF3"       "#D26146"       "#E39C8C"       "#EEC4BA"       "#F9EBE8"  # Create a ggplot chart using this function library(ggplot2) phs_bar_chart <- ggplot(mtcars, aes(x = as.factor(cyl), fill = as.factor(cyl))) +     geom_bar() +   scale_fill_manual(values = phs_colours(c("phs-purple", "phs-magenta", "phs-blue"))) +   theme(legend.position = "none")  phs_bar_chart

title: Standard Graphic Styles for use in Public Health Scotland
code: library(ggplot2) # Apply PHS theme to a chart qplot(mpg, wt, data = mtcars) + theme_phs() # Overwirte a feature (e.g. remove vertical gridlines and add horizontal ones) qplot(mpg, wt, data = mtcars) + theme_phs() +   theme(panel.grid.major.x = element_blank(),          panel.grid.major.y = element_line(colour =                                              grDevices::rgb(190 / 255,                                                             190 / 255,                                                             190 / 255)))

title: Standard Graphic Styles for use in Public Health Scotland
code: # Create a scatter plot using PHS main colour palette library(ggplot2) df <- mtcars df[,'cyl'] <- as.factor(df[,'cyl']) qplot(mpg, wt, data = df, colour = cyl) +    scale_colour_discrete_phs(palette = "main")

title: Standard Graphic Styles for use in Public Health Scotland
code: # Create a bar chart filled with colours from PHS main-blues palette library(ggplot2) ggplot(mtcars, aes(x = as.factor(cyl), fill = as.factor(cyl))) +    geom_bar() +    scale_fill_discrete_phs(palette = "main-blues") +    theme(legend.position = "none")

title: Standard Graphic Styles for use in Public Health Scotland
code: # Create a scatter plot using continuous colours from PHS main-purples palette library(ggplot2) qplot(mpg, wt, data = mtcars, colour = cyl) +    scale_colour_continuous_phs(palette = "main-purples") +    theme_phs()

title: Standard Graphic Styles for use in Public Health Scotland
code: # Create a raster chart filled with reversed continuous colours from PHS # main-purples palette library(ggplot2) ggplot(faithfuld, aes(waiting, eruptions)) +    geom_raster(aes(fill = density)) +    scale_fill_continuous_phs(palette = "main-purples", direction = -1)

title: Standard Graphic Styles for use in Public Health Scotland

Fixing typos documentation, example, isn’t glamorous way contribute, great help package maintainers. Please see blogpost Jim Hester information getting started contributing open source software. contributing, please create branch repository carry work . Please ensure linked RStudio GitHub account using usethis::edit_git_config() prior making contribution. ready review, please create pull request assign package maintainers reviewers. One conduct review, provide feedback , necessary, request changes prior merging branch. Please mindful information governance contributing package. data files (aside publicly available downloadable datasets unless explicitly approved), server connection details, passwords person identifiable otherwise confidential information included anywhere within package repository (whether public private) used within PHS. includes within code code commentary. information security using git GitHub, using git GitHub version control generally, please see Transforming Publishing Programme’s Git guide GitHub guidance. Please feel free add ‘Authors’ section Description file contributing. rule thumb, please assign role author ("aut") writing exported function, contributor ("ctb") anything else. phsstyles , much possible, adhere tidyverse style guide rOpenSci package development guide. pertinent points take : function names lower case, words separated underscore Put space comma, never Put space infix operators <-, == + Limit code 80 characters per line Function documentation generated using roxygen2 Functions tested using testthat possible package always pass devtools::check() ’s necessary experience GitHub building R package contribute phsstyles. wish contribute code , long can write R function, package maintainers can assist error handling, writing documentation, testing aspects package development. advised, however, consult Hadley Wickham’s R Packages book prior making contribution. may also useful consult documentation tests existing functions within package point reference. what: Return hex value for specific named colours — phs_colours
title: Return hex value for specific named colours — phs_colours
text: phs_colours takes named PHS colours returns hex value phs_colour_values

title: Return hex value for specific named colours — phs_colours
code: phs_colours(colourname = NULL, keep_names = FALSE)  phs_colors(colourname = NULL, keep_names = FALSE)

title: Return hex value for specific named colours — phs_colours
text: colourname colour name vector colour names. keep_names whether keep colour names hex values. Defaulted FALSE.

title: Return hex value for specific named colours — phs_colours
text: Named PHS colours can phs-blue, phs-purple

title: Return hex value for specific named colours — phs_colours

what: PHS colours and colour palettes — phs_colour_values
title: PHS colours and colour palettes — phs_colour_values
text: PHS colours colour palettes

title: PHS colours and colour palettes — phs_colour_values
code: phs_colour_values  phs_palettes  phs_palette_types

title: PHS colours and colour palettes — phs_colour_values
text: phs_colour_values - character vector PHS colours hex codes. phs_colour_palettes - list PHS colours grouped palettes. phs_palette_types - list PHS palettes grouped palette types.

title: PHS colours and colour palettes — phs_colour_values
text: http://spark.publichealthscotland.org/media/2176/chart--dashboard-accessibility-guidance-version-12.pdf

title: PHS colours and colour palettes — phs_colour_values
text: PHS colour names corresponding hex codes. phs_colour_values character vector contains PHS colour names PHS chart dashboard guidance, PHS blue.

title: PHS colours and colour palettes — phs_colour_values
text: list grouping PHS colours palettes. used within scale_colour_discrete_phs, scale_colour_continuous_phs, scale_fill_discrete_phs scale_fill_continuous_phs. contains PHS colour palettes main, main-purples.

title: PHS colours and colour palettes — phs_colour_values
text: list grouping PHS palettes PHS palette types. used within scale_colour_discrete_phs, scale_colour_continuous_phs, scale_fill_discrete_phs scale_fill_continuous_phs. groups PHS palettes two types - qualitative sequential. palettes types listed .

title: phsstyles package — phsstyles
text: Standard graphic styles use PHS.

title: phsstyles package — phsstyles
text: See README GitHub.

title: phsstyles package — phsstyles
text: Maintainer: Tina Fu Yuyan.Fu2@phs.scot Authors: Bob Taylor bob.taylor2@phs.scot

what: Continuous colour scales for PHS — scale_colour_continuous_phs
title: Continuous colour scales for PHS — scale_colour_continuous_phs
text: default continuous colour scale use PHS

title: Continuous colour scales for PHS — scale_colour_continuous_phs
code: scale_colour_continuous_phs(   ...,   type = "seq",   palette = 1,   direction = 1,   values = NULL,   space = "Lab",   na.value = "grey50",   guide = "colourbar",   aesthetics = "colour" )  scale_color_continuous_phs(   ...,   type = "seq",   palette = 1,   direction = 1,   values = NULL,   space = "Lab",   na.value = "grey50",   guide = "colourbar",   aesthetics = "colour" )

title: Continuous colour scales for PHS — scale_colour_continuous_phs
text: ... Additional parameters passed scale type type "seq" (sequential). Please see phs_palette_types details. palette number describing palette use within type. Defaulted 1 referring first palette "main-purples" type "seq". can also actual name palette e.g. main-purples. Please see phs_palettes details. direction either 1 (following palette order) -1 (reversing palette order). Defaulted 1. values colours evenly positioned along gradient vector gives position (0 1) colour colours vector. space colour space calculate gradient. Must "Lab" - values deprecated. na.value Missing values replaced value. guide function used create guide name. Defaulted "colourbar". aesthetics defaulted "colour"

title: Continuous colour scales for PHS — scale_colour_continuous_phs
text: list continuous colour scales using interpolated method can used PHS charts, interpolating colours main-purples contains phs-purple, phs-purple-80, phs-purple-50, phs-purple-30 phs-purple-10.

title: Continuous colour scales for PHS — scale_colour_continuous_phs
code: ggplot2::qplot(mpg, wt, data = mtcars, colour = cyl) + scale_colour_continuous_phs(palette = "main-purples") #> Warning: `qplot()` was deprecated in ggplot2 3.4.0.   ggplot2::qplot(mpg, wt, data = mtcars, colour = cyl) + scale_color_continuous_phs(palette = "main-purples")

what: Discrete colour scales for PHS — scale_colour_discrete_phs
title: Discrete colour scales for PHS — scale_colour_discrete_phs
text: default discrete colour scale use PHS

title: Discrete colour scales for PHS — scale_colour_discrete_phs
code: scale_colour_discrete_phs(   ...,   type = "seq",   palette = 1,   direction = 1,   aesthetics = "colour" )  scale_color_discrete_phs(   ...,   type = "seq",   palette = 1,   direction = 1,   aesthetics = "colour" )

title: Discrete colour scales for PHS — scale_colour_discrete_phs
text: ... Additional parameters passed scale type type either "seq" (sequential) "qual" (qualitative). Defaulted "seq". Please see phs_palette_types details. palette number describing palette use within type. Defaulted 1 referring first palette "main-purples" type "seq". can also actual name palette e.g. main-purples. Please see phs_palettes details. direction either 1 (following palette order) -1 (reversing palette order). Defaulted 1. aesthetics defaulted "colour"

title: Discrete colour scales for PHS — scale_colour_discrete_phs
text: list discrete colour scales can used PHS charts, main-purples contains phs-purple, phs-purple-80, phs-purple-50, phs-purple-30 phs-purple-10.

title: Discrete colour scales for PHS — scale_colour_discrete_phs
code: df <- mtcars df[,'cyl'] <- as.factor(df[,'cyl']) ggplot2::qplot(mpg, wt, data = df, colour = cyl) + scale_colour_discrete_phs(palette = "main")   df <- mtcars df[,'cyl'] <- as.factor(df[,'cyl']) ggplot2::qplot(mpg, wt, data = df, colour = cyl) + scale_color_discrete_phs(palette = "main")

what: Continuous colour filling scales for PHS — scale_fill_continuous_phs
title: Continuous colour filling scales for PHS — scale_fill_continuous_phs
text: default continuous colour filling scale use PHS

title: Continuous colour filling scales for PHS — scale_fill_continuous_phs
code: scale_fill_continuous_phs(   ...,   type = "seq",   palette = 1,   direction = 1,   values = NULL,   space = "Lab",   na.value = "grey50",   guide = "colourbar",   aesthetics = "fill" )

title: Continuous colour filling scales for PHS — scale_fill_continuous_phs
text: ... Additional parameters passed scale type type "seq" (sequential). Please see phs_palette_types details. palette number describing palette use within type. Defaulted 1 referring first palette "main-purples" type "seq". can also actual name palette e.g. main-purples. Please see phs_palettes details. direction either 1 (following palette order) -1 (reversing palette order). Defaulted 1. values colours evenly positioned along gradient vector gives position (0 1) colour colours vector. space colour space calculate gradient. Must "Lab" - values deprecated. na.value Missing values replaced value. guide function used create guide name. Defaulted "colourbar". aesthetics defaulted "fill"

title: Continuous colour filling scales for PHS — scale_fill_continuous_phs
text: list continuous colour filling scales using interpolated method can used PHS charts, interpolating colours main-purples contains phs-purple, phs-purple-80, phs-purple-50, phs-purple-30 phs-purple-10.

title: Continuous colour filling scales for PHS — scale_fill_continuous_phs
code: library(ggplot2) ggplot(faithfuld, aes(waiting, eruptions)) + geom_raster(aes(fill = density)) + scale_fill_continuous_phs(palette = "main-purples", direction = -1)

what: Discrete colour filling scales for PHS — scale_fill_discrete_phs
title: Discrete colour filling scales for PHS — scale_fill_discrete_phs
text: default discrete colour filling scale use PHS

title: Discrete colour filling scales for PHS — scale_fill_discrete_phs
code: scale_fill_discrete_phs(   ...,   type = "seq",   palette = 1,   direction = 1,   aesthetics = "fill" )

title: Discrete colour filling scales for PHS — scale_fill_discrete_phs
text: ... Additional parameters passed scale type type either "seq" (sequential) "qual" (qualitative). Defaulted "seq". Please see phs_palette_types details. palette number describing palette use within type. Defaulted 1 referring first palette "main-purples" type "seq". can also actual name palette e.g. main-purples. Please see phs_palettes details. direction either 1 (following palette order) -1 (reversing palette order). Defaulted 1. aesthetics defaulted "fill"

title: Discrete colour filling scales for PHS — scale_fill_discrete_phs
text: list discrete colour filling scales can used PHS charts, main-purples contains phs-purple, phs-purple-80, phs-purple-50, phs-purple-30 phs-purple-10.

title: Discrete colour filling scales for PHS — scale_fill_discrete_phs
code: library(ggplot2) ggplot(mtcars, aes(x = as.factor(cyl), fill = as.factor(cyl))) + geom_bar() + scale_fill_discrete_phs(palette = "main-blues") + theme(legend.position = "none")

what: Public Health Scotland theme for ggplot2 charts. — theme_phs
title: Public Health Scotland theme for ggplot2 charts. — theme_phs
text: adds certain styles ggplot2 charts conform Public Health Scotland style guidelines.

title: Public Health Scotland theme for ggplot2 charts. — theme_phs
code: theme_phs()

title: Public Health Scotland theme for ggplot2 charts. — theme_phs
code: ggplot2::qplot(mpg, wt, data = mtcars) + theme_phs()

title: phsstyles 0.1.2 (2024-08-06)
text: Exported phs_colour_values, phs_palettes phs_palette_types. now allows users call phsstyles functions without needing load package.

title: phsstyles 0.1.1 (2022-05-30)
text: Make axis title blank theme_phs() (#3). Add alias function phs_colours(), scale_colour_discrete_phs() scale_colour_continuous_phs() users can use American spelling “color”. Update documentation phs_palettes phs_palette_types. Create pkgdown webpage readme, help pages news page integrated.

title: phsstyles 0.1.0 (2021-10-15)
text: Initial package release. phs_colours(), theme_phs(), scale_colour_discrete_phs(), scale_colour_continuous_phs(), scale_fill_discrete_phs() scale_fill_continuous_phs() functions added.
